comments.body: nit: I'm not sure we need it - it will be added by gofmt anyway (note that the whole code is not formatted, to formatting just these comments makes it non-consistent).

Yeah, and it makes formatting proto idl (which has no gofmt equivalent)
harder.

On Nov 27, 2015, at 5:20 AM, Wojciech Tyczynski notifications@github.com
wrote:

In cmd/libs/go2idl/generator/execute.go
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/17853#discussion_r46033739:

>  }
> 
>  // format should be one line only, and not end with \n.
>  func addIndentHeaderComment(b *bytes.Buffer, format string, args ...interface{}) {
>   if b.Len() > 0 {
> -     fmt.Fprintf(b, "\n\t// "+format+"\n", args...)
> -     fmt.Fprintf(b, "\n// "+format+"\n", args...)

nit: I'm not sure we need it - it will be added by gofmt anyway (note that
the whole code is not formatted, to formatting just these comments makes it
non-consistent).

â€”
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/17853/files#r46033739.

That's a good point.
I'm completely fine with adding it, although, I'm not sure if that helps much for protos (but probably it's better with that).
Is it 100 lines or 100 chars? If it is the former, we should probably print less...
I'm wondering about this one - if we can't run gofmt on that file, there may be some serious problem. Shouldn't we just return error in that case without even trying to produce this file?
No-- it's super hard to debug the generator if you can't see the output :)
Sorry - I wasn't clear. I didn't mean removing the error - I meant removing writing to destFile in the next line.
Right-- that's what I meant. If we don't write the file, the generator author will have a very hard time debugging, there's no other way they will see the output!
